result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan J. Mullen

records.addlTxt:
9:33 AM cases 22CF884, 22CM466 called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ryan J. Mullen appeared by video, in custody from Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney David W. Field in court for Ryan J. Mullen. Attorney Field notes he was recently appointed and requests a new return date. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/31/2022 at 1:15 PM
Hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:41 AM cases 22CF887, 22CM466 called. Defendant Ryan J. Mullen appeared by video, in custody without counsel.  Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant would like an attorney. Court orders defendant to contact the SPD office within 2 days.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:20 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan J. Mullen in court. Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Defendant indicated he will apply for Public Defender. 
Warrant quashed; bond continues.

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 08/08/2022 at 2:15 PM
Hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:18 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan J. Mullen not in court. 
State request warrant.
Warrant issued.

(11:27 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ryan J. Mullen appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Katherine Cook appeared by video for Ryan J. Mullen.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
Defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation.
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on June 27, 2022 at 2:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
